conclusion: Understand the condition for total internal reflection using Snell's law.
Identify the critical angle using Snell's law: \( \theta_c = \arcsin \left( \frac{1}{N} \right) \).
The optical fiber has a circular cross-section and is bent into a semicircle with ends A and B.
Relate the critical angle to the geometry: \( \tan \theta \leq \frac{1}{N} \) and \( \frac{d}{R} \leq \frac{1}{N} \).
Determine that \( R \geq dN \) from the relation \( \frac{d}{R} \leq \frac{1}{N} \).
Find the minimum turning radius \( r \) such that the light exits the fiber: \( r \geq dN \).
The turning radius \( r \) of the central axis of the optical fiber should be not less than \( dN \).
